revised_title: Sterol Metabolism and Utilization in Insects: A Comprehensive Review
tldr: This article discusses the metabolic pathways of steroids in insects, focusing on the conversion of plant sterols to cholesterol and the biosynthesis of steroid moulting hormones (ecdysones). It highlights the role of sterols in insect growth, metamorphosis, and reproduction, and examines the biological and physiological significance of these pathways in insects, as well as their relationship to analogous pathways in plants and vertebrates.
